meanings.definition: Inclined to talk a lot in a friendly and informal way.
meanings.sent1: She is always chatty during our lunch breaks.
meanings.sent2: The chatty group of friends laughed and shared stories.
meanings.sent3: The chatty parrot in the pet store entertained the customers.
meanings.sent4: Her chatty nature was like a bubbling brook, never running dry.
meanings.sent5: The chatty atmosphere at the party made everyone feel welcome.

meanings.definition: Characterized by informal and lively conversation.
meanings.sent1: The chatty cafe buzzed with energy and laughter.
meanings.sent2: Their chatty banter filled the room with warmth.
meanings.sent3: The chatty radio host kept the listeners entertained with jokes.
meanings.sent4: The chatty market was a symphony of voices and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The chatty street corner was a hub of gossip and news.

meanings.definition: Talkative in a friendly and informal way.
meanings.sent1: The chatty neighbor always had a story to share.
meanings.sent2: The chatty children giggled and chattered happily.
meanings.sent3: The chatty cat meowed loudly to get attention.
meanings.sent4: The chatty stream of conversation flowed effortlessly between them.
meanings.sent5: The chatty mood in the room made everyone feel at ease.
